title: Chapter 391
content: # Chapter 391 The flail was a swinging tool. Stabbing or cutting with it? Impossible. That's why Grid chose black iron wood as the material. *Resilience is what matters for this type of weapon.* Black iron wood was 'bent iron.' High rigidity, high elasticity. Typically used for spears, and expensive as hell. The rankers and knights of every kingdom needed spears made of black iron wood if they wanted to compete. *In other words, it's top-tier material.* Buying it had hurt his wallet. Still, Grid believed the finest materials were the only acceptable choice for his creations. He was a legendary blacksmith. How could he work with garbage? *The expenses, though. Damn.* **Ttang! Ttang!** Grid swallowed his bitterness and hammered the black iron wood into submission. First, a 1.3-meter pole. Then four long sticks attached to the end. The pole's width fit comfortably in his grip. The slender branches? Trimmed sharp and thin. *This feels right.* Shaving. Combining. Repeating the process. Grid examined the shaped sticks and anticipated greatness. A legendary item, surely. But the system disagreed. > [You have completed the production of the Motley Flail.] > [Motley Flail] > > Rating: Unique > > Durability: 259/259 | Attack Power: 143~191 > > * A special effect will occur every time the target is hit. The effect is unpredictable. > > * Thrashing speed will increase by 150%. > > * There is no guarantee how the condition of the thrashed grain will change. > > Farming equipment designed by Grid, who has been reborn as a legend. > > Made of solid black iron wood, it boasts excellent durability and attack power. The quality approaches that of a weapon. > > However, the effects cannot be guaranteed due to the influence of Silverun's Secret Remedy. Use with caution. It is recommended that you do not use it. > > User Restriction: Level 200 or higher. > > Weight: 109 "...Shit. Just a little bit more." Would it kill the universe to grant his wishes once? Just once? Sticks didn't notice Grid's frustration. "That's a fine flail. Excellent farming equipment, it seems." The sarcasm was obvious. *Why is he making farming tools?* Grid straightened. "This isn't farming equipment. It's a weapon. I'm using this to break through the 41st island." "A weapon?!" Sticks's eyes widened in admiration. Grid's spirit was remarkable. Using a flail as a trump card? Sticks was a sage, after all. A wise man. He tried to understand Grid rather than dismiss him as eccentric. *There must be profound reasoning behind this.* That didn't mean he felt confident about it, though. Sticks watched Grid grab the hammer again. *I'll gift the Unique-rated one to Piaro.* One more attempt. *I need a Legendary-rated flail!* **Ttang! Ttang!** Grid pledged himself to the forge and started on the spare black iron wood. He achieved the desired form. Added Silverun's Secret Remedy. The result? Another Unique-rated flail. "...This fucking $%!#." It had been ages since he'd cursed like this. His thinking power had expanded. His personality had matured. But his essence? Unchangeable. A year and a half since becoming Pagma's Descendant. Only 12 legendary items in all that time. Even a saint would rage. *Why can't a legendary blacksmith make legendary items?* Probability-based bullshit. Grid recognized it once again and forced himself to calm down. *Okay. Breathe. I don't need a legendary flail to clear the 41st island.* True. Grid didn't want the flail for attack power. He only needed the random effect to create a reversal. A legendary rating would've been nice for the special event and stat boost, but obsession led to ruin. "Time to practice." Twenty-one hours had passed creating and crafting the flail. Grid needed to master it in the next three hours, until the cooldown on his immortality reset and Noe and Randy returned. --- **The 41st Island** "Bring it on." "..." The clone stared at Grid. It saw the flail in his hands and paused, puzzled. As an entity possessing 100% of Grid's abilities, it found the weapon choice... strange. > [Motley Flail] > > ... "..." The clone checked the flail's options. Its confusion deepened. *An inefficient weapon.* Why would he choose this? The clone questioned it briefly, then dismissed the thought. The clone's purpose was singular: hurt Grid. Questioning the behavior of someone about to die was pointless. "Pagma's Swordsmanship." **Teong!** The clone surged forward. Its movement was dazzling, like butterfly wings. The precursor to Link. **Pit!** **Pipipipipit!** The clone unleashed its assault. Sharp energy blades erupted from Grid's Greatsword, slicing toward Grid. Twenty-four hours ago, Grid would have dodged and countered. But now? He'd regained his original judgment. Those swords flying at him? *I won't block them!* **Pepepepeok!** Blood misted around Grid's body as Link tore through him. Why didn't he defend? Simple: faster counterattack. Grid absorbed the enemy's strike and swung the flail. **Hwiririk!** "...!" The clone's eyes widened. It had been hit. Grid's speed was incomparably faster than expected, throwing its calculations into disarray. **Peeok!** The flail cracked across the clone's face. A sound like a bursting watermelon. Blood scattered, but the appearance was deceptive. The four thin sticks were sharp enough to trigger bleeding, but the actual damage? Low. But damage wasn't the point. **Ssik!** Grid's mouth curved upward. "Let's see what happens!" The Motley Flail triggered a random effect on hit. Buff or debuff. The worst case? Buffing the target. *A debuff won't help much.* Grid knew. The clone was identical to him. Debuffs wouldn't have significant impact. Still, the reason Grid fought with the flail was simple: belief. *It'll have a definite effect, not a simple debuff...!* For example: reducing the target's health to 1 point. Maxing out the weight gauge. These weren't classified as debuffs, so Grid's resistances wouldn't save him. > [The effect of the Motley Flail is triggered!] The flail activated immediately after striking the clone. A flash of light. > [The target's attack power will double for 10 seconds.] "..." Grid had prepared himself. An unlucky bastard like him, relying on random effects? The odds of a positive outcome were lottery-level. But even so, this was excessive. *If its attack power doubles...!* Grid backpedaled as the clone's greatsword moved. **Seokeok!** "Kuak!" A basic attack. The impact felt like a skill. Grid's eyes shook as devastating damage tore through his health bar. Still, he didn't forget to retaliate. > [The effect of the Motley Flail is triggered!] > > [The target's maximum health will triple for 10 seconds.] > [The effect of the Motley Flail is triggered!] > > [The target's skill damage will increase by 20% for 10 seconds.] > [The effect of the Motley Flail is triggered!] > > [Grants a shield spell to the target.] > [The effect of the Motley Flail is triggered!] > > [The target has been affected by the silence state.] > > [The target has resisted.] "Ah, seriously!" Grid's fury mounted as the battle dragged on. **Pisik.** The clone sneered. The first emotion it had shown. "You bastard...!" Grid's teeth ground together. At a glance, it looked like he'd lost his reason. But reality was different. Grid had anticipated this. He was prepared to die a few more times. He kept striking the clone, activating the flail's effect over and over. The clone, meanwhile, grew careless. The flail's effects continuously favored him. He stopped avoiding Grid's attacks, pressing his advantage instead. > [You have suffered fatal damage!] > > [A legend doesn't die easily. You can resist all attacks for 5 seconds with a minimum of health.] Grid's health bottomed out. He'd tried to generate more effects by speeding up his attacks with Blackening, Blacksmith's Rage, and Quick Movements, but it only helped the clone. *No choice. I'll have to get lucky on the next attempt.* Grid surrendered this round. He cleared his mind and wielded the flail. The clone didn't bother dodging anymore. The odds of the flail threatening him were like finding a needle in a desert. The clone's AI was impressively high, truly. The concept of 'chance' meant nothing to it. The clone mocked him through action. **Peeok!** "...!" Right before Grid's immortality passive expired, the clone took a flail strike to the face. Grid was even more shocked than his opponent. > [The effect of the Motley Flail is triggered!] > > [Change health values with the target.] "...!" The clone's confusion was instant. It scrambled for a potion. "Where do you think you're going?" Grid smiled with savage satisfaction and kicked the clone's abdomen. The clone's health dropped to 1, triggering its immortality state. "I can't miss this opportunity." Grid's declaration rang out. He summoned Noe and Randy. The moment to end this long battle had arrived. --- **Glossary of Common Korean Terms** OG: Glossary Link Current schedule: 20 chapters a week.
